title: Eraclus becomes the 25th bishop of Liège.
text: Eraclus becomes the 25th bishop of Liège.

title: Song dynasty general Yue Fei defeats an army led by Jin dynasty general Wuzhu at the Battle of Yancheng during the Jin–Song Wars.
text: Song dynasty general Yue Fei defeats an army led by Jin dynasty general Wuzhu at the Battle of Yancheng during the Jin–Song Wars.

title: Minamoto no Yoritomo becomes Sei-i Taishōgun and the de facto ruler of Japan. (Traditional Japanese date: July 12, 1192)
text: Minamoto no Yoritomo becomes Sei-i Taishōgun and the de facto ruler of Japan. (Traditional Japanese date: July 12, 1192)

title: King Stefan Uroš III, after months of anarchy, surrenders to his son and rival Stefan Dušan, who succeeds as King of Serbia.
text: King Stefan Uroš III, after months of anarchy, surrenders to his son and rival Stefan Dušan, who succeeds as King of Serbia.

title: Henry the Navigator leads Portuguese forces to victory over the Marinids at the Battle of Ceuta.
text: Henry the Navigator leads Portuguese forces to victory over the Marinids at the Battle of Ceuta.

title: Pueblo Indians capture Santa Fe from the Spanish during the Pueblo Revolt.
text: Pueblo Indians capture Santa Fe from the Spanish during the Pueblo Revolt.

title: The Battle of Dunkeld in Scotland.
text: The Battle of Dunkeld in Scotland.

title: James Cook formally claims eastern Australia for Great Britain, naming it New South Wales.
text: James Cook formally claims eastern Australia for Great Britain, naming it New South Wales.

title: King Gustav III completes his coup d'état by adopting a new Constitution, ending half a century of parliamentary rule in Sweden and installing himself as an enlightened despot.
text: King Gustav III completes his coup d'état by adopting a new Constitution, ending half a century of parliamentary rule in Sweden and installing himself as an enlightened despot.

title: American Revolutionary War: British forces begin besieging the French outpost at Pondichéry.
text: American Revolutionary War: British forces begin besieging the French outpost at Pondichéry.

title: A Vodou ceremony, led by Dutty Boukman, turns into a violent slave rebellion, beginning the Haitian Revolution.
text: A Vodou ceremony, led by Dutty Boukman, turns into a violent slave rebellion, beginning the Haitian Revolution.

title: Battle of Vimeiro: British and Portuguese forces led by General Arthur Wellesley defeat French force under Major-General Jean-Andoche Junot near the village of Vimeiro, Portugal, the first Anglo-Portuguese victory of the Peninsular War.
text: Battle of Vimeiro: British and Portuguese forces led by General Arthur Wellesley defeat French force under Major-General Jean-Andoche Junot near the village of Vimeiro, Portugal, the first Anglo-Portuguese victory of the Peninsular War.

title: Jean-Baptiste Bernadotte, Marshal of France, is elected Crown Prince of Sweden by the Swedish Riksdag of the Estates.
text: Jean-Baptiste Bernadotte, Marshal of France, is elected Crown Prince of Sweden by the Swedish Riksdag of the Estates.

title: Jarvis Island is discovered by the crew of the ship, Eliza Frances.
text: Jarvis Island is discovered by the crew of the ship, Eliza Frances.

title: Nat Turner leads black slaves and free blacks in a rebellion in Southampton County, Virginia, which will claim the lives of 55 to 65 whites.
text: Nat Turner leads black slaves and free blacks in a rebellion in Southampton County, Virginia, which will claim the lives of 55 to 65 whites.

title: Tlingit Indians destroy Fort Selkirk, Yukon Territory.
text: Tlingit Indians destroy Fort Selkirk, Yukon Territory.

title: Lawrence, Kansas is destroyed by pro-Confederate guerrillas known as Quantrill's Raiders.
text: Lawrence, Kansas is destroyed by pro-Confederate guerrillas known as Quantrill's Raiders.

title: An F5 tornado strikes Rochester, Minnesota, leading to the creation of the Mayo Clinic.
text: An F5 tornado strikes Rochester, Minnesota, leading to the creation of the Mayo Clinic.

title: The first successful adding machine in the United States is patented by William Seward Burroughs.
text: The first successful adding machine in the United States is patented by William Seward Burroughs.

title: Oldsmobile, a brand of American automobiles, is founded.
text: Oldsmobile, a brand of American automobiles, is founded.

title: Six hundred American school teachers, Thomasites, arrived in Manila on the USAT Thomas.
text: Six hundred American school teachers, Thomasites, arrived in Manila on the USAT Thomas.

title: The Mona Lisa is stolen by Vincenzo Perugia, a Louvre employee.
text: The Mona Lisa is stolen by Vincenzo Perugia, a Louvre employee.

title: World War I: The Battle of Charleroi, a successful German attack across the River Sambre that pre-empted a French offensive in the same area.
text: World War I: The Battle of Charleroi, a successful German attack across the River Sambre that pre-empted a French offensive in the same area.

title: World War I: The Second Battle of the Somme begins.
text: World War I: The Second Battle of the Somme begins.

title: World War II: The flag of Nazi Germany is planted atop Mount Elbrus, the highest peak of the Caucasus mountain range.
text: World War II: The flag of Nazi Germany is planted atop Mount Elbrus, the highest peak of the Caucasus mountain range.

title: World War II: The Guadalcanal Campaign: American forces defeat an attack by Imperial Japanese Army soldiers in the Battle of the Tenaru.
text: World War II: The Guadalcanal Campaign: American forces defeat an attack by Imperial Japanese Army soldiers in the Battle of the Tenaru.

title: Dumbarton Oaks Conference, prelude to the United Nations, begins.
text: Dumbarton Oaks Conference, prelude to the United Nations, begins.

title: World War II: Canadian and Polish units capture the strategically important town of Falaise, Calvados, France.
text: World War II: Canadian and Polish units capture the strategically important town of Falaise, Calvados, France.

title: Physicist Harry Daghlian is fatally irradiated in a criticality accident during an experiment with the Demon core at Los Alamos National Laboratory.
text: Physicist Harry Daghlian is fatally irradiated in a criticality accident during an experiment with the Demon core at Los Alamos National Laboratory.

title: The Soviet Union successfully conducts a long-range test flight of the R-7 Semyorka, the first intercontinental ballistic missile.
text: The Soviet Union successfully conducts a long-range test flight of the R-7 Semyorka, the first intercontinental ballistic missile.

title: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs an executive order proclaiming Hawaii the 50th state of the union. Hawaii's admission is currently commemorated by Hawaii Admission Day
text: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs an executive order proclaiming Hawaii the 50th state of the union. Hawaii's admission is currently commemorated by Hawaii Admission Day

title: American country music singer Patsy Cline returns to record producer Owen Bradley's studio in Nashville, Tennessee to record her vocals to Willie Nelson's "Crazy", which would become her signature song.
text: American country music singer Patsy Cline returns to record producer Owen Bradley's studio in Nashville, Tennessee to record her vocals to Willie Nelson's "Crazy", which would become her signature song.

title: Motown releases what would be its first #1 hit, "Please Mr. Postman" by The Marvelettes.
text: Motown releases what would be its first #1 hit, "Please Mr. Postman" by The Marvelettes.

title: Xá Lợi Pagoda raids: The Army of the Republic of Vietnam Special Forces loyal to Ngô Đình Nhu, brother of President Ngo Dinh Diem, vandalizes Buddhist pagodas across the country, arresting thousands and leaving an estimated hundreds dead.
text: Xá Lợi Pagoda raids: The Army of the Republic of Vietnam Special Forces loyal to Ngô Đình Nhu, brother of President Ngo Dinh Diem, vandalizes Buddhist pagodas across the country, arresting thousands and leaving an estimated hundreds dead.

title: Cold War: Nicolae Ceaușescu, leader of Communist Romania, publicly condemns the Soviet-led Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia, encouraging the Romanian population to arm itself against possible Soviet reprisals.
text: Cold War: Nicolae Ceaușescu, leader of Communist Romania, publicly condemns the Soviet-led Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia, encouraging the Romanian population to arm itself against possible Soviet reprisals.

title: James Anderson, Jr. posthumously receives the first Medal of Honor to be awarded to an African American U.S. Marine.
text: James Anderson, Jr. posthumously receives the first Medal of Honor to be awarded to an African American U.S. Marine.

title: A bomb exploded in the Liberal Party campaign rally in Plaza Miranda, Manila, Philippines with several anti-Marcos political candidates injured.
text: A bomb exploded in the Liberal Party campaign rally in Plaza Miranda, Manila, Philippines with several anti-Marcos political candidates injured.

title: Lebanese Civil War: The first troops of a multinational force lands in Beirut to oversee the Palestine Liberation Organization's withdrawal from Lebanon.
text: Lebanese Civil War: The first troops of a multinational force lands in Beirut to oversee the Palestine Liberation Organization's withdrawal from Lebanon.

title: Philippine opposition leader Benigno Aquino, Jr. is assassinated at the Manila International Airport (now renamed Ninoy Aquino International Airport in his honor).
text: Philippine opposition leader Benigno Aquino, Jr. is assassinated at the Manila International Airport (now renamed Ninoy Aquino International Airport in his honor).

title: Carbon dioxide gas erupts from volcanic Lake Nyos in Cameroon, killing up to 1,800 people within a 20-kilometer range.
text: Carbon dioxide gas erupts from volcanic Lake Nyos in Cameroon, killing up to 1,800 people within a 20-kilometer range.

title: The 6.9 Mw Nepal earthquake shakes the Nepal–India border with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), leaving 709–1,450 people killed and thousands injured.
text: The 6.9 Mw Nepal earthquake shakes the Nepal–India border with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe), leaving 709–1,450 people killed and thousands injured.

title: Latvia declares renewal of its full independence after the occupation of Soviet Union.
text: Latvia declares renewal of its full independence after the occupation of Soviet Union.

title: Coup attempt against Mikhail Gorbachev collapses.
text: Coup attempt against Mikhail Gorbachev collapses.

title: NASA loses contact with the Mars Observer spacecraft.
text: NASA loses contact with the Mars Observer spacecraft.

title: Tiger Woods, American professional golfer, wins the 82nd PGA Championship and becomes the first golfer since Ben Hogan in 1953 to win 3 majors in a calendar year.
text: Tiger Woods, American professional golfer, wins the 82nd PGA Championship and becomes the first golfer since Ben Hogan in 1953 to win 3 majors in a calendar year.

title: Hundreds of people are reported killed by chemical attacks in the Ghouta region of Syria.

title: The closing ceremony of the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, takes place.

title: A solar eclipse traverses the continental United States.
